oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-11-26 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 26, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers Tompall and the Glaser Brothers, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1103rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Archie Campbell; Tompall Glaser; Glaser Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Everybody's Somebody's Fool (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tompall and the Glaser Brothers -- Sweet Love Goodbye (Tompall and the Glaser Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Ernest Tubb talk -- Stand By Me (Ernest Tubb) -- Grant Turner introduces Chet Atkins -- Little Rock Getaway (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Rhodes, Leon; Tompall & Glaser Brothers; Glaser Brothers; Glaser, Tompall; Glaser, Jim; Glaser, Chuck; Drake, Pete
